# Building Inventory Analysis Dashboard This project presents an interactive dashboard analyzing the Illinois government building inventory dataset using Python, Altair, and Vega-Lite visualizations. ## Visualization 1: Building Space Distribution Analysis This linked visualization explores the relationship between building square footage distribution across government agencies and their construction timelines. **Visual Encoding:** - **Left Heatmap**: Position encoding on both axes with color encoding showing building concentration by size and agency - **Right Histogram**: Length encoding for building counts with dynamic filtering based on heatmap selections **Data Processing:** - Cleaned dataset by removing records with missing construction years or square footage values - Binned square footage into 10 quantile-based groups for better distribution visualization - Implemented interactive brushing to connect agency-size patterns with construction timelines **Insights**: Reveals how different government agencies constructed facilities of various sizes during different historical periods. ## Visualization 2: Building Status and Geographic Analysis This dashboard examines building status categories and their geographic distribution across Illinois counties. **Visual Encoding:** - **Left Stacked Bar Chart**: Length encoding for total square footage with color encoding by usage type - **Right Scatter Plot**: Position encoding for construction year and county, with size and color encoding **Data Processing:** - Aggregated square footage by status and usage categories - Calculated summary statistics for county-agency combinations - Created derived age categories to identify historical building patterns **Insights**: Interactive linking enables exploration of how building status correlates with geographic distribution and construction eras, helping identify regional infrastructure patterns. --- ## Data & Methods
